name: Fix Search Input Focus Loss Bug

userStories.title: Add separate loading states to JobList component
userStories.description: As a developer, I want to separate initial loading from filter loading so that the form remains mounted during filter updates.
acceptanceCriteria: Add initialLoading state variable for first mount loading
Add isFiltering state variable for subsequent filter-triggered fetches
initialLoading is true only until first successful fetch completes
isFiltering is true during filter/sort/search updates

userStories.title: Update fetchJobs to use appropriate loading states
userStories.description: As a developer, I want fetchJobs to set the correct loading state based on whether it's the initial load or a filter update.
acceptanceCriteria: Initial load sets initialLoading to true
Filter updates set isFiltering to true instead of replacing the entire component
Loading states are properly reset on fetch completion

userStories.title: Update render logic to keep form mounted during filtering
userStories.description: As a user, I want the search/filter form to remain visible and interactive while results are loading so I don't lose focus.
acceptanceCriteria: Full-page Loading component only shows when initialLoading is true
Filter form (search, sort, date range) remains mounted when isFiltering is true
User can type continuously in search input without losing cursor focus
Filter controls remain interactive during loading

userStories.title: Add inline loading indicator for results grid
userStories.description: As a user, I want to see a loading indicator on the results area when filters are updating so I know the system is responding.
acceptanceCriteria: Loading indicator/overlay appears over the job results grid during filter updates
Initial page load can still show full-page loading state
Loading indicator does not block filter form interaction

userStories.title: Verify search input maintains focus during typing
userStories.description: As a QA tester, I want to verify that the search input focus bug is fixed and search results update properly.
acceptanceCriteria: User can type full search query without focus interruption
Search results update as user types
No regression in existing filter, sort, or date range functionality
